Comment: If they own a house it is public record, if you give me your name I bet I can find your phone number, address, and even your parents information.  SSN is the only private information you listed and that is not doxing that is identity theft.  Good try though.     Doxing is taking a private and/or anonymous person and posting their information because not being private anymore is the punishment the doxer is seeking.  Law enforcement by definition are not private citizens.  You can not dox law enforcement.

Comment: Not a lawyer, but if it's applicable to FOIA Exemption 6, expect it would be a reasonable case for a civil suit:  "Exemption (b)(6) prohibits the disclosure of any record which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy such as information found in personnel and medical files.  Examples of exemption 6 records are performance appraisals; records on an employee's medical condition, history, and test results; personally identifiable information such as name, social security number, military service number, home address and telephone number, age, place and date of birth, etc.; and payroll information such as number of deductions, number of withholding exemptions, and net wages."  Good try though.  EDIT: Could also fall under FOIA exemption 7c too.   Short answer. Is it illegal? Likely no. Could you reasonably be successfully sued? Absolutely.
Author: Geek_Ken

Comment: Man you literally have no idea what you are talking about.  You just want to be right.    FOIA is when you request information from the government.  Those are the rules of what the government can and cannot supply to the public under a FOIA request.  It has nothing to do with what the general public can post anywhere. If you buy a house, the owner of the house is written down in the town records, it is public information, the rest of the information you listed is volunteered by the individual via the internet, facebook, subscription service, etc.  Posting that information that can be googled is not doxxing.       You are not a lawyer, and you don't understand basic concepts like who the law binds in this case it binds the government not any of us.  Your comment is completely irrelevant, not on topic.
Author: Bigbeardhotpeppers
